'''Ivo Lah''' ({{IPA-sl|ˈiːvɔ ˈlax|pron}}; September 5, 1896 – March 23, 1979) was a [[Slovenia]]n [[mathematician]] and [[actuary]], best known for his discovery of the [[Lah number]]s in 1955 and for the [[Lah identity]].<ref name=tomas/>

Lah was born at [[Štrukljeva Vas]], near [[Cerknica]], [[Austria-Hungary]], now in [[Slovenia]], and died at [[Ljubljana]], [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]], also now in Slovenia.<ref name=tomas/>
